definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: There is the problem of finding a mate, and fighting off rivals.
sentences.chinese: 要命的是得花力氣尋找配偶，還要擊退情敵。

sentences.english: When I love you when I see who are like.
sentences.chinese: 當我喜歡你的時候，我看誰都像情敵。

sentences.english: Is likewise, son-in-law ugg short age father-in-law were originally antagonistic in loves.
sentences.chinese: 也是，女婿和老丈人本來就是情敵。

sentences.english: Hera became so greeneyed that she flew down from Olympus one day to pay her rival  back .
sentences.chinese: 一天她飛下奧林波斯山向情敵施加報復。

sentences.english: Your enemy is sleeping, and his woman is free.
sentences.chinese: 那你的情敵會安然入睡，而他的女人已然自由。

definition: to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
